notes.text:
Red Hat AMQ Broker 7.10.7 is now available from the Red Hat Customer Portal.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
AMQ Broker is a high-performance messaging implementation based on ActiveMQ Artemis. It uses an asynchronous journal for fast message persistence, and supports multiple languages, protocols, and platforms.

This release of Red Hat AMQ Broker 7.10.7 includes security and bug fixes, and enhancements. For further information, refer to the release notes linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* (CVE-2023-5072) JSON-java: parser confusion leads to OOM
* (CVE-2024-1132) keycloak: path transversal in redirection validation

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat AMQ Broker 7.10.7 release and security update

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A flaw was found in the org.json package. A bug in the parser exists, and an input string may lead to undefined usage of memory, leading to an out-of-memory error, causing a denial of service (DoS).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: JSON-java: parser confusion leads to OOM
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability may cause denial of service with a small string input, causing the server to be unresponsive easily, hence the Important impact.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
No current mitigation is available for this flaw.

vulnerabilities.title: JSON-java: parser confusion leads to OOM

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Keycloak, where it does not properly validate URLs included in a redirect. This issue could allow an attacker to construct a malicious request to bypass validation and access other URLs and sensitive information within the domain or conduct further attacks. This flaw affects any client that utilizes a wildcard in the Valid Redirect URIs field, and requires user interaction within the malicious URL.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: keycloak: path transversal in redirection validation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Build of Quarkus is not impacted as this CVE affects the server-side Keycloak execution, but Quarkus only acts as a Keycloak client in its quarkus-keycloak-authorization extension. For this reason, Quarkus is marked as having a Low impact.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
No current mitigation is available for this vulnerability.
